item.title: Report E-2024040510
item.description:
Report E-2024040510

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: VISALIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN2924 was damaged due to manufacture error and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to adjacent freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel deployed absorbents to the release and worked them in with hand tools. The crew overpacked the damaged container in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All impacted debris was containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. All waste was staged onsite for disposal.

  • City: SYLMAR

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A CALL CAME IN TO RESPONSE AT UNLOAD DOOR 18. THERE WAS A METAL BUCKET CONTAINING PRIMER PAINT. DECISION TREE STEPS WERE TAKEN TO ENSURE CLEAN UP SPILL AND CONTAINING SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE HAZMAT DEPT. TO FOLLOW DMP DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2024041086
item.description:
Report X-2024041086

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-25T15:11:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: SYLMAR
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: METAL PAIL WAS INSIDE FEEDER TRUCK IN DOOR 16. THERE WAS PAINT LEAKING FROM THE PAIL AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STACK. IDENTIFIED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND FOLLOWED DECISION TREE GUIDELINES. THE LABEL AND SHIPPING PAPERS OFFERED INFORMATION ON LEAKER. PICKED UP PAIL AND RESIDUE WITH CLAY ABSORBENT AND TRANSPORTED IT TO HAZMAT AREA AND TURNED ON THE FAN TO CIRCULATE AIR. RESPONDER CONTINUED WITH DMP PROCESS.

item.title: Report X-2024040739
item.description:
Report X-2024040739

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-11
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=651287459475 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=Unloading ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1263 CLASS=30 QTY UOM=Liquid - Liter PSN TEXT=PAINT PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=4 CONTAINER UOM=Liquid - Liter MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=0 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=1 TOTAL UOM=Liquid - Liter )During sort operations at the OAKH facility a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained six metal cans inside packaged with sytrofoam peanuts for dunnage. One of the six cans was dented causing the lid to come off and spill it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and the shipper was contacted for an amended declaration for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024040760
item.description:
Report X-2024040760

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was set aside due to staining on carton and the sound of broken glass. Package presents as dry, no spill/leakage site was reported nor located in the unload or on the dock. There is internal stains on the sides of carton and on the top, but not the bottom. Package didn't visually present as having leaked 4 liters of liquid internally, bottom of the package is dry and not stained as having been wet. DescribePack: 1 Glass bottle encased in molded cardboard partitioned base, hooded with the same broke, DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: No sign of any release reported or located in or outside trailers in the unload or elsewhere on the dock.

item.title: Report X-2024040829
item.description:
Report X-2024040829

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-10
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was damaged during route delivery and was brought back to the station. QA used a hazmat tote and absorbent pads to transport the package to the hazmat cage. Upon inspection there were no hazmat labels and there was no bracing for the items inside. The paint cans inside were dented and there were no paint can clips. DescribePack: The paint cans inside were dented and there were no paint can clips. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA used a hazmat tote and absorbent pads to transport the package to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024040735
item.description:
Report X-2024040735

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-22T15:11:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: LONG BEACH
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Notification for container # TEMU 063147 leaking at ICTF in Long Beach, CA. Contractor responded and found that the ty-guard for blocking and bracing was torn, and the load shifted causing abrasion in 3 55-gallon metal drums, releasing a total of 20 gallons. Damaged drums were overpacked and all impacted areas were cleaned properly.

  • City: El Segundo

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Release time was 30 seconds. Loaders were back loading a propane car at approx. 2245. As they were making there rounds they noticed a small leak on spot 4 west. As they approached to investigate there was a large cloud coming from the dome of the car. They closed the valves for the car and notified the head operator. The head operator watered down the car and area. The cause of the incident was a faulty gauging device. ,

item.title: Report X-2024040723
item.description:
Report X-2024040723

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-12
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 11th, a package was observed to have smoke coming out of it during the sort. The package was removed to the outside of the facility in case a full fire erupted. Emergency services were not called to examine the package. Shortly after the smoke lessened and the box was no longer hot to the touch. The package was brought in and examined and it was determined that there were four non-spillable batteries inside, two of which showed scorch marks from a small fire. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and is being help pending disposition. The NRC was notified of the fire at approximately 2300, report # 1396190.

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-08
  • City: ANAHEIM
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 8, 2024, one (1) 50-pound box of UN2821 was damaged during unloading and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel deployed absorbent pads to the UN2821-impacted dock floor. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum and all damaged containers were then placed into one (1) 55-gallon overpack. Both drums were then staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024040375
item.description:
Report E-2024040375

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-05
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 5, 2024, three (3) pallets of one-gallon pails of paint were damaged due to improper securement during shipping and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Ten-West Environmental (TWE) to remediate the impacted site. TWE personnel collected and containerized 196 1-gallon pails of UN1263 into five (5) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 95-gallon overpack for disposal purposes. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the trailer floor and worked them in with hand tools. The damaged cardboard and all UN1263 impacted materials were collected and containerized into two (2) 30-gallon drums for disposal purposes.
